***

The heroines would not arrive until a few hours after you, you had been informed. A private escort lead you to your room, which was even larger and more elegant than you had hoped. You tipped the man, and looked around the room, taking in your surroundings.

         "Complementary." Read the note placed in front of the bottle. Deciding alcohol would be a good idea to ease your nerves (you do not want to make an ass of yourself in front of the heroines), you open the bottle and take a decent sized swig. It tastes rich, warm; it tastes the way a good alcohol should. And something more. Your head becomes groggy, and you laugh giddily before your vision fades to black.

12122.title: Ms Marvel

121221.content:
The first door you come to has a "do not disturb" sign hung from the brass door-knob. This gives you pause, you don't want to openly defy the wishes of whomever this room belongs you. However, you really didn't have much of a choice. Being out in the open like this made you feel exceedingly exposed, and you were still in dire need of help. Besides, helping people is what heroines did. Even when it wasn't convenient for them.
         You slip under the door like you did your own, and see a room that looks similar to yours- complete with the nightstand and mini-bar. No "Micro-Brew," however. Figures. There was something, however, this room had that your's did not. That "something" was the breathtakingly beautiful Carol Danvers. Ms Marvel. She was sitting at her desk, slaving over something. Wasn't she always. Her prominent brow was furrowed as she chewed her bottom lip, studying what seemed to be an astrological chart of some variety.
         She was in costume. This didn't surprise you. Ultimately, the heroines were here on your behalf, and dressing in civilian clothes would have been detrimental to the experience. Her long, blonde hair hung over her shoulders and breasts. Her breasts. Perfect spheres that dominated her chest, clad in skin tight black Whatever the Hell her suit was made out of. Your eyes followed traced the angular outline of her slender, toned waist down to her thigh. Smooth, marble-like flesh rippled with muscle, flexing and relaxing rhythmically as she focused- apparently a quirk of hers. The woman's ski-high boots ended just above the knee in a beautiful golden stripe.
         Her toned shoulders were reflecting the sunlight coming in through the window, making them glow. Her frame was broad, but elegant. Prominent, yet feminine.
121221.title: Carol Danvers

1212212.content:
If she had registered your presence at all, she wasn't phased by it. More than likely, she was too focused to notice your entrance. You consider calling out to her, but can't find your voice. Instead, you take a slow step towards her, gaining confidence and walking faster when you don't fall through the floor. Your approach to the massive beauty takes ages, you're too small for your legs to cover any significant ground.
         You were halfway to her when it happened. A sudden, exasperated sigh escaped from the woman as she violently swiped the chart from her desk. Her chair shot backwards as her powerful leg muscles tensed to stand up. She really was a tall woman, even compared to a person of normal size. Her hips swayed as she walked despite her stormy demeanor. The upper portion of her long legs rubbed together as she stepped. God, she was sexy.
         So sexy that it too you too long to realize she was headed for the door. She was headed for you, and she still hadn't seen you. This was bad. This was very bad. If she stepped on you, you would almost certainly be killed- her foot was like a semi-truck compared to your body. Worst of all, you had no time to run. Sure, you could try, but you just wouldn't reach the door before her. Not with those strides she was taking.
         With your heart racing, you watched the beautiful legs grow closer and closer, preparing to dodge her feet should need arise. The pristine woman was nearly to you, and you held your breath to aid in focusing. You were so filled with adrenaline that calling out to her never even occurred to you.
